original_solution_mapping.L1: Alice was able to stack 27 + 37 = <<27+37=64>>64 plates she already stacked.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The tower crashes when there are 83 plates - 64 plates already stacked = <<83-64=19>>19 plates she was able to stack before the tower crashed.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6288.
    Returns: the number of additional plates Alice was able to add before the tower fell.
    """
    # L1
    initial_plates = 27 # 27 plates on top of each other
    added_plates_first_batch = 37 # adds 37 more plates
    plates_stacked_initially = initial_plates + added_plates_first_batch

    # L2
    total_plates_at_crash = 83 # all 83 plates
    additional_plates_before_crash = total_plates_at_crash - plates_stacked_initially

    # FA
    answer = additional_plates_before_crash
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Alice was able to stack {initial_plates} + {added_plates_first_batch} = <<{initial_plates}+{added_plates_first_batch}={plates_stacked_initially}>>{plates_stacked_initially} plates she already stacked.

The tower crashes when there are {total_plates_at_crash} plates - {plates_stacked_initially} plates already stacked = <<{total_plates_at_crash}-{plates_stacked_initially}={additional_plates_before_crash}>>{additional_plates_before_crash} plates she was able to stack before the tower crashed.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Alice was able to stack 27 + 37 = <<27+37=64>>64 plates she already stacked.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The tower crashes when there are 83 plates - 27 plates already stacked = <<83-27=56>>56 plates she was able to stack before the tower crashed.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'initial_plates' (value: 27) was used instead of 'plates_stacked_initially' (value: 64).
